website_summaries.verdict: A good quality bit set that isn't super expensive, but varies on longevity.
pros: This six-piece set features auger bits from 1/2 to 1-1/4 inches
Full screw tip allows bit to self feed
cons: Some buyers say the bits dull quickly

customer_reviews.title: great but not super durable
customer_reviews.text: First off, I use these in a Makita 18v impact driver for drill through studs and top plates for electrical. They go through wood with no issues other than wood chips clogging on long drills. If you hit a nail, these are done. They are fragile and any nail hit ruins them. That being said, I usually get a good 5-10 resharpens with a small rat tail file before I retire them. Just file them equally in number of strokes so that the blades stay about the same length.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Cut through studs like butter
customer_reviews.text: I was using Irwin spade bit set to bore holes into studs to run electrical and speaker wires. 18v Drill thru 2x4 would take a couple of mins, drilling through a 6 inch PSL paralam would take nearly 30min with lots of arm and shoulder pain. I was skeptical of the auger set, but once I used it, it was amazing. Using an 18v impact driver, no strain and no pressure since the bit is self-feed. It took me 20 secs to go through a 2x4, and about 1 min to go through the PSL w/ 1-1/4 bit. Can't believe I worked without this before. My go to solution for boring holes now.
customer_reviews.author: DrLomax

customer_reviews.title: Great bits!
customer_reviews.text: These are the fastest boring bits I have used in 20+ years of professional woodworking. I needed to drill a lot of holes in a beech wood (i.e. - very hard wood) timber frame barn and I was shocked at how quickly these pulled into the wood without having to apply much pressure. Backing the bits out takes more effort than usual and required that the impact driver be reversed, but well worth it to not have to apply a mountain of pressure. 60 plus big holes drilled with no bit burning or marked reduction in cutting efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: clickity3

customer_reviews.title: the diameter of the bits near the base of these ...
customer_reviews.text: the diameter of the bits near the base of these bits narrows, and makes the bits bend on the first or second try... I use these doing residential electric, and drilling into 2x4's after one or two uses, the bits bent. I have found that Bosch Daredevil?? bits have a larger diameter all the way down the shaft, creating a bit that doesn't bend
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lucas

customer_reviews.title: I did order this and received it but alot of stuff I didn't and why won't Amazon call back
customer_reviews.text: Since I did order this product and recived it and love it 5 stars however I've been shopping on Amazon I have Asperger's Syndrome for those of you don't know it's autism I thought Amazon was the only story that can take advantage of me however I guess I thought wrong my phone number used to be linked to my account and it suddenly disappears when there's a bunch of items I didn't choose or buy and now it won't let me add my number back on it and Amazon refuses to call me back when I requested a billion calls
customer_reviews.author: Christina and David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Just as I remembered, I love drilling with these. Running wires through framework is 10x easier with these bits. No effort and with Irwin quality, they are never going to break, unless you do something ridiculous. Would buy again but I imagine these will last my lifetime with ease! Used them the day they arrived to drill through a bunch of framing and some 7" thick posts. Used the 12" Irwin extension as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K. Nilsson

customer_reviews.title: Chews Through Wood
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easy to drill holes for electrical wiring and plumbing lines in studs and top plates. A lot faster than the paddle bits I use to use all the time. Also, these have lasted a long time without need to sharpen. By now, I would have used several paddle bits for the same amount of work. Highly recommend these bits.
customer_reviews.author: Blackjack101

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Auger Bits
customer_reviews.text: The Irwin bits are very sharp and make for clean cuts. They are short and can be used in tight spaces which is really convenient. I generally do not use Auger bits as I prefer to use brad point or Forstner bits for wood working projects. But when (1) it is not a precision hole or (2) a deep hole is needed, or (3) a quick hole is required these are the best. I have used them to create holes for running 14/2 and other wires in very small quarters. The case they come in is solidly built and makes for a nice kit
customer_reviews.author: M. Salmon

customer_reviews.title: Works only with High torque impact driver!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I could not drive these bits with my 18v Millwalkie, plug in drill or drill press. A friends impact driver will, then they cut very fast but lookout. I wouldn't expect a clean hole coming out of a 2x4 or 4x4 given the speed and torque necessary to drive these bits. Irwin, post something that tells people this info!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Drill holes in wood fast
customer_reviews.text: The bits eat up wood fast. Makes drilling holes for pulling cable easy. I had wood bit before that would dull easy and make the wood start to burn. Scary when you drilling in the attic and hoping to not start a fire. The tip of the bit stays centered and pulls the rest of the blade quickly through the wood. Comes in a nice and rugged case.
customer_reviews.author: BrianAndCyn

customer_reviews.title: Eats through fast.
customer_reviews.text: If you're drilling through something heavy and secure it'll blow right through it, like joists for instance. I used one on a 2" thick oak entry door and I had to stop it quick because I wasn't wanting to go clear through, just wanted to countersink a 1/2". If the work isn't really secure, though, it'll try and throw it instead of boring into it. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff L

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold an edge.
customer_reviews.text: These are a major disappointment and the final straw with Irwin tools. I have been using these to drill douglas fir and spruce framing timber and within 20 holes the bits were getting dull. I hit a nail with one and immediately rendered it useless. Once the threaded section penetrates the other side of the wood, you have to ram the bit through the wood finish the cut. Will not buy Irwin bits again. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great, though I'd pay slightly more for hardened materials
customer_reviews.text: These are like a spade/auger combo bit. The move through wood very fast, but for some reason, mine get to that last 1/8" and then require force to simply blow open the end of the hole. Up until that point, they are perfect. The shank metal seems a little soft, as I've rounded a few, but it could be that I slacked on the chuck. I don't see a reason to use a spade bit ever again. I'm using an 8 yr old Makita 18V cordless and these chew through everything I throw at them. I'm curious if anyone has the same issue with either the shank, or that last 1/8"...
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Like these so much more than spade bits. I have used these for drilling holes for running wires all throughout my house. Makes quick work of wood! Huge time saver and takes a lot less effort than when i use to use spade bits. This is a great set for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer S.Top Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: These are incredibly dull. This didn't get an eighth of an inch ...
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly dull. This didn't get an eighth of an inch into white oak before it stopped up my drill press and i had to twist it out with pliers, I used another bit on 3/4 MDF and it took an inordinate amount of time and pressure to get it through. I don't know what happened. Irwin used to make good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: N. George

customer_reviews.title: Best Wood Buts I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: These are the best wood bits I have ever used. The screw tip pulls the bit into the wood without a lot of pushing against the drill. They have three cutting edges instead of two, cutting through the wood much faster. Awesome wood bits!!
customer_reviews.author: dlong6839

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality. These work very well drilling through older, very solid wood. Pretty hard on my electric drill but I was drilling through 6 inch older wood. They pull the drill through very nicely and bore some perfect holes.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K Knechtly

customer_reviews.title: Fastest augers I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Blows away basic spade and Forster bits. It bores so fast you’re going to need a powerful drill for the bits greater than 3/4 to prevent stoppage. The only disadvantage is it creates a lot of wood shavings so there’s significantly more cleanup than a hole saw would require.
customer_reviews.author: ELG

customer_reviews.title: Spiral Beavers!
customer_reviews.text: These things are hungry for wood. They chomp right through it, and the holes are very clean and smooth. The bits are aggressive, but much easier to handle than a spade bit or hole saw. They do a descent job of chip/dust ejection too! They are one of my better recent purchases!
customer_reviews.author: B Jingles

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Use them all the time, hold up as well as expensive auger bit for joists, top/bottom plate drilling, and if you hit a nail you're not out so much money. Better drilling and self-feed than paddle or spade bit. Works well with impact drill; have never shattered one.
customer_reviews.author: Neil K.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I am a commercial electrician. So I know a few things about using these bits. They are pretty good. Its nice that they come with a 1-1/4" bit. I have been using these for about a month now. Only complaint is that that the 1-1/4" is starting to dull. Granted its still sharp, but it could be sharper since its still so new. Update 12/12/12 All of the bits either have completely rounded off shoulders and/or the shanks have bent. Granted the shank problem could be my fault, I think they are just able to stay straight when hitting nails or screws.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Definitely fast! Need strong drill and strong arm!
customer_reviews.text: Once these bite into the wood they go pretty quickly. You need a pretty powerful drill to handle them once they fully bite in though, and you need to have a good grip so it doesn't start spinning the drill instead of the bit!
customer_reviews.author: Christian L

customer_reviews.title: Strong bits.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set for a good price. I have owned a 3 piece set of these and were very happy with them.. They are a wood boring monster! You really have to hold on tight to the drill or it will twist out of your hand. The only reason I had to buy this set was because on my other set I was boring holes through old framing to run electrical wires and hit nails. Nails kill these bits. I trashed 2 of my 3 on 1 job. Other than hitting nails, these bits are great. Delivered quickly and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Performance
customer_reviews.text: Hang on to your drill, these self-feeding bits will pull you through. Each bit has a screw-threaded tip, so when it grabs the wood, it will pull itself through. I have found it is best to use the lower speed (higher torque) setting on the cordless drill. With the Irwin extensions:, I have cut holes through a stack of nine 2x4s with ease. The only issue is reversing the bit back out of the hole, it can be tricky if you are cutting through thicker material. I will never use a standard spade bit again, these are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: RickZ

customer_reviews.title: Great set of auger bits!
customer_reviews.text: Used the largest one to bore through studs from the basement all the way up to the attic through two levels and these held up great. They chew right through the studs and the flooring with ease and made the job smooth. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: B. Tigano

customer_reviews.title: Aggressive and accurate.  Great bits for larger boring.
customer_reviews.text: Man are these things aggressive! Just want I needed boring tenons etc through 3 1/2 inch thick wood for a Moravian work bench build. Very sharp, very quick and easy to be accurate with them. I am very happy with them, and the work saved.
customer_reviews.author: William Rooks

customer_reviews.title: Cuts holes like cutting butter!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than spade bits and not as funky as forstner bits. These get the job done very well. I am new to IRWIN tools but having seen how well this bit works, i may just purchase more cool toys from them soon!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ryan

customer_reviews.title: but if you go down to the round shank they are fine. One thing you need to know is you ...
customer_reviews.text: These bits can really bore a hole, but for some reason when you use the quick change they wobble, but if you go down to the round shank they are fine. One thing you need to know is you won't be boring a very large hole if all you have is a 3/8 drill, 1/2 inch to 5/8 that's it, any larger and you have to go up in drill size, the drill size required to use these bits is not stated.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Loftis

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The drills dulled after 10 studs were drilled. Junk in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: SHerman O.

customer_reviews.title: nice bits
customer_reviews.text: so far used them to bore holes in my work bench. i drilled a small pilot hole, my dewalt 18v strained a little because of the bit grabbed so well,backed out and switcheb to a larger corded dewalt. must work these like all tools , slow and easy. i knew the wood was free of nails so cannot comment on hitting obects in the wood. but i would recomend these to any one, with the same advice if you are going to rush dont use them till you can take your time the result will reflct that
customer_reviews.author: artie2385

customer_reviews.title: Dig fast, but are not invincible
customer_reviews.text: My set of these are pretty well burned out, but I did build my house using them, including running my own wiring so I can't dog them too badly. Inevitably, you'll hit an unexpected screw or nail and that's pretty much it - it's sharp edge is gone. When they are new they cut so fast that you have to be careful where it's headed and if you care about tear-out on the other side - which I think is a good thing. The screw head digs into pine no problem. I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jarpe

customer_reviews.title: Good for close quarter drilling
customer_reviews.text: Cut fast in most woods. 4-6" total length depending on bit size make them better than spade blades for close quarter drilling, however also limits the depth of hole without bit extender.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: These bits rule!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these Speedbor bits for years - this is my 3rd or 4th set. They are fantastic! Best in the business! Easily drill large holes, no problems!
customer_reviews.author: JMI

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Using battery drill, drilled through wood with ease. Revising my review still very good bits until you hit an unseen nail than you may as well throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: KEN

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: If you use these in seasoned oak beams with a hoe hog you better get a good grip and hold on tight cause they are going to cut. Make sure not to apply pressure to the drill because the bits will overpower you.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Gastineau

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking case and bits, but cannot say they worked for me?
customer_reviews.text: These bits were nicely packaged with a nice case, but I could not get them to work very well. Stopped after 1/4" penetration in wood, but perhaps I was not using them slowly enough. Had much better luck with the Jumbo Brad Point Drill Bit Set sold on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: LRD

customer_reviews.title: Best Hex Auger Bits around
customer_reviews.text: Probably the beat auger bits I've used for small jobs. Especially in tight areas. I have two sets of these and I love that they are hex designed for impact drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Han Hattori Hanzo

customer_reviews.title: Great bits
customer_reviews.text: These bits are FAST. I couldn't believe how quickly they tore through 65 year old joists as hard as concrete. As other reviews call out, they do require a drill with enough power to turn them. Don't expect a 12v compact to have the strength for it. 18v Li-Ion Makita was more than sufficient, though. Great storage case, too, so they aren't bouncing around in a bag or toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Priester

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drill Augur Bit
customer_reviews.text: I Wish the sharpness of these bits lasted more than a couple use. It seemed like at every new hole it took more effort, force and time to drill through the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I've never found anything that cuts a hole faster than these bits. And keeping them in this case is sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Mary & Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic bits! SPEEDbor indeed! I had some old two-blade bits that did not have the "self-feeding" screw at the tip, and it would take at least a minute of difficult labor to get through a large (old) floor joist. With these bits, it took less than ten seconds to get through the same joist, and the bit did all of the work. That's with a cordless drill, too! The case is a tad large and has a stiff latch, but the important part - the bits - are great!
customer_reviews.author: R. Brome

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace a cheap set of space bits. I looked at a lot of options online and at the store. These seem to be the best designed and they work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin McAteer

customer_reviews.title: awesome bits
customer_reviews.text: I'm a DIYer, but in my opinion these are pro level bits. Good hard case (but a bit hard to latch)
customer_reviews.author: PixelPusher

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: It works well but the 1 1/2 but will not work with my Milwaukee m12 which doesn't have the power to drill with it but all the other bits work like a dream
customer_reviews.author: Jlange

customer_reviews.title: Super fast wood bits
customer_reviews.text: If you need to drill a lot of large-bore holes in wood, this set of bits works much better than any flat-blade bit I've ever used. If anything, these work too well and can drill through the intended piece of wood and the two layers of wood below it in the blink of an eye. The trick is to apply only light pressure and to keep the drill speed on the slow side.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Very aggressive
customer_reviews.text: Very aggressive. Make sure that is what you want if you buy these. They will splinter like hell when they exit and make sure you have a decent side handle if you have a powerful drill. I was drilling 6 X 6 fir, using an extension with a Milwaukee Hole Shooter and was pretty amazing how fast they were.
customer_reviews.author: zigzagg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for MDA Boring
customer_reviews.text: Got these when I needed to bore out a number of MDA cabinet doors for cylinder locks. The bit just sailed through the wood. I used a General drill guide for squareness with a 1/2" line-operated drill (my battery drill just didn't have the torque needed). This seems like a useful set to have around, with a lot more stability in drilling than regular spade bits.
customer_reviews.author: Voiceguy

customer_reviews.title: Great bit drills fast. Try a good impact.
customer_reviews.text: Great bit set works great with a strong impact. Need to have a strong drill behind this bit.
customer_reviews.author: DeFilippo

customer_reviews.title: Not for impact
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well except I don't think they are impact rated. Used with my Milwaukee impact and sheared off two of the shafts.
customer_reviews.author: Bjlaskey

customer_reviews.title: Like Butter
customer_reviews.text: These bits are amazing. I had to drill 1000 holes through a 2x12 for an installation piece and these bits just went through the wood like it was butter. After 1,000 holes on the 1/2" bit, it's only slightly less sharp than when I started. The screw-tip on these pull the bit through for you, so it hardly takes any effort. Easily 10x faster than a forstner or spade bit. These can surprise you with how fast they bore a hole.
customer_reviews.author: nanabanana

customer_reviews.title: best boring bits I've used
customer_reviews.text: these things are fabulous. what I particularly like is the boring tip - it seats the bit, pulls through the wood, and then once it clears the other side STOPS pulling so you know you're about ready to complete the hole. nice touch when drilling near other stuff you dont want to damage. highly recommended, thumbs up. makes spade bits look little league.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Whaley

customer_reviews.title: works like charm, through fine grain wood and any others
customer_reviews.text: Wood eaters.. This kit, works like charm, through fine grain wood and any others, thends to chip wood, but nothing stops make a very descent work, blue box its awesome Just because one of these loose in your pocket could harm you, and this keep organized,stacked, whatever order you want
customer_reviews.author: Yanan Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great for running wire
customer_reviews.text: Love these bits. Worked great for running wire through top plate. Just make sure you have a good grip on your drill because these things bite in.
customer_reviews.author: Mantis Toboggan, M.D.

customer_reviews.title: capable and quick
customer_reviews.text: i used the 3/4" drill for drilling through two pieces of wood that were sandwiched together for a total width of about 2.5 inches. i used a dewalt 18v on the low speed/high torque setting and it didn't have much trouble getting through the wood. the self-feed really does do the work for you, much better than the regular spade bits. update: if i could i would rate this as a 5 star product. it goes through everything i've put it up against. vertical grain fir, old growth wood, etc. it just burns right through. awesome for running wires, plumbing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: These are great self feeding augers
customer_reviews.text: These are great self feeding augers, don't be too aggressive with the big bits as they will break off at the hex adapter!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Over rated
customer_reviews.text: Very bad product I saw all good review and I order these drill bits by far the worst drill bit
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. With an impact drill you can put a hole through would fast.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: For very ordinary jobs
customer_reviews.text: I really eats the wood. Its finish is brutally gross. Beware of larger diameter bits. It may cause an injury due to its high demand of torque in a fraction of second.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Not new product.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in sealed clamshell - but one bit inside was used (worn paint) and there was grease and finger prints on the interior case. Terrible quality control. Very dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Fast, clean, sharp.
customer_reviews.text: These bits cut clean and fast. Still sharp after alot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Clean, rapid cutting
customer_reviews.text: These are a tremendous improvement over the standard spade bits. They drill much more quickly because they are spiraled like a bit, rather than just chipping away. They also drill perfectly round, smooth holes without splintering the surrounding wood. Once you see this in action, you'll never go back to the old spade bits again. Sean P. Logue, 2007
customer_reviews.author: Sean Logue

customer_reviews.title: Make nice clean exit holes
customer_reviews.text: Bits cut through wood and other materials without effort. Make nice clean exit holes. Case is surprisingly compact.
customer_reviews.author: woolstar

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your bit collection
customer_reviews.text: If you need to drill a hole that it is hard to get any leverage to push on the bit, this is a great bit! The self feeding feature just pulls the bit through the wood. Great addition to your bit collection.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Biswanger

customer_reviews.title: fast, clean, price effective
customer_reviews.text: at JazzyJoelProductions we do new, reno, temporary: stage, lighting, audio, video, commercial, industrial, residential, custom projects... We demand quality equipment that performs the the right-way the first time, every-time! JOB-site life saver, need a hole these do it fast and clean!
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Nice tools
customer_reviews.text: Manufactured with high quality material. Cust clean with minimal fuss. Seems to be fairly durable and holds its edge well, but if course, that will depend how you use and it and what kind of material are you drilling with. Overall, a quality tool and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Collectorque

customer_reviews.title: Great bits
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and perfect for drilling holes in 2 X material.
customer_reviews.author: Skip the Winter

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Blazes right through wood. Have been drilling through top plates and studs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not all good
customer_reviews.text: The price is good but the 1 1/4 bit is about 3mm out of center - disapointing. The others I have tried were good though I have not tried them all yet
customer_reviews.author: OrenWood

customer_reviews.title: the only way to bore!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love these boring bits!! they are aggressive and plow right through that wood. what makes then even better than the spade type bits, is the screw end that just pulls the bit through the wood. they are very high quality and stay sharp.thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Mcgrath

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about these years ago
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Nearly 30 years of using normal flat spade type bits for boring holes and I never knew a better bit existed. These are night and day to those, and rather than having to push hard getting leverage over your head against whatever you can, these things actually pull themselves through the wood - you need to actually pull back some on the drill to slow it down!
customer_reviews.author: SMTrekkers

customer_reviews.title: Great bits
customer_reviews.text: These self feed auger bits are great for light duty use. If your drilling 3 or 4 stacked 2x4s I don't recommend these, but if your drilling a top plate, or some plywood or something, you won't find a better bit set, I've had these for a couple months and theyre still doing the job, so don't hesitate just buy them and let em speak for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I like the case very much for the bits
customer_reviews.text: I like the case very much for the bits. The bits cut well for drilling through 2 x4s. Not a perfect finish on the bit grind but they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Buehler

customer_reviews.title: Great Tools
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They cut so much faster than the standard spades I had. Good selection of sizes included. Used them on some really hard wood for the first test and I was amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Outta Control

customer_reviews.title: great set of bits
customer_reviews.text: Nice aggressive drilling to get the job done quickly. you just need a decent drill with a lot of torque for some wood.
customer_reviews.author: komptek

customer_reviews.title: fast
customer_reviews.text: These suckers are fast! I have to run the cordless drill on low or these bog it. With a bigger corded drill they blow through wood.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great High Speed drill bits
customer_reviews.text: Great High Speed drill bits. If you expecting to use these with a small drill they won't work. They require some force since they cut very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in these bits.
customer_reviews.text: I had nothing but trouble trying to drill hard maple. I tried my corded drill after my drill press and it still bound on the tip. Very disappointed in these bits.
customer_reviews.author: JustMy2Cents

customer_reviews.title: These babies cut like crazy. Not for fine cabinetry
customer_reviews.text: These babies cut like crazy. Not for fine cabinetry. They are workhorse drill bits. Hang on to your drill! They bore into wood aggressively.
customer_reviews.author: John Dulin

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buyer....
customer_reviews.text: Been using speedbor for near 10 years now, won't use anything else. Only downside is they don't like nails. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Terrel

customer_reviews.title: What I needed
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a 1-1/4" hole bit and this set of triple blade bits works so much better and gives a smother cut than my older spade bits. It fits perfectly with my hammer drive which gives me tat extra punch to get through hardwoods.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Rough handling
customer_reviews.text: I've used these bits before, they're great.... But they came with a broken case :(
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: great quality, sharp easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: drills holes in wood very easy with my 18 v Ryobi drill.
customer_reviews.author: yankee  catman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best bit for drilling through studs to run wire. Fast and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: The perfect wood drill
customer_reviews.text: These drills are great! Much better than the spade style. They cut through the wood like butter.
customer_reviews.author: gary pringle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bit.
customer_reviews.text: Great price, stays sharp! Beats the cheaper HF ones by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Best Bet Bits
customer_reviews.text: For a fast and clean hole, these bits are truly a pleasure to use. I bought these as replacement bits after my other Irwin Speebor Max Spade Bits went out on permanent loan. :) I am a repeat, happily satisfied customer of these long lasting bits.
customer_reviews.author: JD in BTR

customer_reviews.title: Great drill bits
customer_reviews.text: All the drill bits I have that work well are made by Irwin. Best made bits I have found. Sharp, cut fast and easy, and are durable. Highly recommend all their bits.
customer_reviews.author: K. McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Does what you expect
customer_reviews.text: Fast and keep an edge even if you hit a nail from time to time. They cut a rough hole, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: NewMidwesterner

customer_reviews.title: and they like to grab your work
customer_reviews.text: These bits will hog out a hole fast, and they like to grab your work. Perfect for through-cuts, but be careful if you are only trying to drill half-way into material, for countersinking washers, nuts, bolts, and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Fagerstrom

customer_reviews.title: I love these things
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. I've had a single bit for some time and it has held up well to use. Drills quick too, you have to chase it through the wood. Haven't broke open the new pack yet.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Keeney

customer_reviews.title: Avoid the jamming issue when drilling large holes in wood
customer_reviews.text: Don't you hate it with those flat bits that get stuck and start torquing the whole drill around, particularly at the end of the hole? Me too, these are basically just huge drill bits that maintain the integrity of the shaft.
customer_reviews.author: AK zero°bike

customer_reviews.title: Nice BUT.
customer_reviews.text: Nice BUT ... 1. Too Short. Only good for 2-by. 2. Too Aggressive. They dig in too much. 3. Forget plywood or thin material. 4. The case broke.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Love these bits for drilling wood, far better than a spade type bit!
customer_reviews.author: smackey02

customer_reviews.title: Quick Cuts but Not Precision
customer_reviews.text: Good drills for the price. Do not run true, I.E., there is a lot of run out but for rough work like drilling holes in studs to run wire, they cut fast and the runout is not an issue. Not for fine wood working.
customer_reviews.author: WJ from Utah

customer_reviews.title: I use these in my ratchet driver as the drill ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my ratchet driver as the drill wouldn't be able to keep up with the aggressive bite these have. They are a welcome addition to my shop.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: CUTS CLEANLY AND QUICKLY.  ALSO, EASY TO LOAD INTO CHUCK !
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a set just like this. Better than using "spade bits", and sharp right out of the box. It cuts clean holes with tearout only minimal. Excellent for inexpensive self-feeding bits.
customer_reviews.author: K.D.

customer_reviews.title: Cut fast.
customer_reviews.text: These cut very fast. Used with battery powered drill-driver to cut through studs. Just don't hit a nail! It is not designed to cut through nails. Other than that, great drills.
customer_reviews.author: Meadow01

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best
customer_reviews.text: No doubt about it, these pull themselves through wood like it's butter but you'd better have some horsepower to use them. They bring any cordless I have to a dead stop so you'll need a corded drill to handle these.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: good quality and good price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for each of my work trucks. I love them, good quality and good price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Rockaways Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these bits are like tigers, very aggressive and they work grrrrrreeeaaattttt !!!
customer_reviews.author: pskemp2

product_meta.title: IRWIN SPEEDBOR Drill Bit Set, Auger, 6-Piece (3041006)
product_meta.description:
The IRWIN SPEEDBOR Max Speed Drill Bit Set, 6 Piece, features 6 of the most commonly used drill bits with a tri-flute design for faster chip ejection, cutting spurs with 3 cutting edges for extra durability, full screw tips for self-feeding, and grooved hex shanks that prevent slipping in all standard 1/4" quick change chucks. Our fastest SPEEDBOR bits ever, this set includes 1/2", 5/8", 3/4", 7/8", 1", and 1-1/4" bits and a soft case.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Irwin Industrial Tools 3041006 6-Piece Set Speebor Max (1/2, 5/8, 3/4, 7/8, 1 and 1 - 1/4-Inch). For fast, rough or clean and exact holes, Irwin's extensive line of woodboring drill bits provide the user with the best available tools for each application in achieving their wood drilling needs.
feature_bullets: The Fastest Speebor spade bit ever
Tri-Flute design for faster chip ejection
Cutting spurs have 3 cutting edges for added durability
Full screw tip allows bit to self feed
Grooved hex shank prevents slipping in drill chuck or bit extension

specifications.Included Components: IRWIN Tools SPEEDBOR Max Speed Auger Wood Drill Bit Set, 6-Piece, 3041006
